docs.title: About Me
docs.text:
Hi! I'm Kishna Kushwaha, an AI/ML Engineer based in Delhi, India.

I specialize in building end-to-end Machine Learning pipelines, from data scraping to model deployment. Currently, I am focused on Computer Vision and Agentic AI solutions.

docs.title: Understanding Logistic Regression
docs.text:
Date: December 18, 2025

Classification is one of the most fundamental tasks in Machine Learning. Today I want to explore how Logistic Regression works under the hood.

docs.title: The Sigmoid Function
docs.text:
Unlike Linear Regression which outputs continuous values, Logistic Regression transforms the output using the Sigmoid function:

$$S(x) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{-x}}$$

docs.title: Code Example
docs.text:
Here is how I implemented it in Python:

```python import numpy as np

def sigmoid(x): return 1 / (1 + np.exp(-x))

x = np.array([1, 2, 3]) print(sigmoid(x))
